subject: Urgent: Your account has been compromised - Verify Now
body:
Dear Customer,

We have detected suspicious activity on your PayPal account. Your account has been temporarily limited. You must verify your identity within 24 hours or your account will be permanently suspended.

Click the link below to verify your account immediately:
https://paypa1-verify.suspicious-domain.com/login

Failure to act will result in permanent account closure.

PayPal Security Team

dangerousPhrases.reason: Creates fear and panic to rush decision-making
Artificial urgency to prevent careful thinking
Threatens severe consequences to force action

reasons: Sender domain 'paypa1-support.com' uses number '1' instead of letter 'l' to impersonate PayPal
Creates artificial urgency with 24-hour deadline
Threatens permanent account suspension to induce fear
Contains suspicious link that doesn't match PayPal's official domain
Generic greeting 'Dear Customer' instead of using your actual name

links.reason: Domain impersonates PayPal using lookalike characters. Actual PayPal URLs use paypal.com

recommendation: Do NOT click any links. This is a phishing email impersonating PayPal. Delete immediately and report to PayPal directly through their official website.

subject: Updated Employee Benefits - Action Required
body:
Hello Team,

We have updated our employee benefits package for 2025. Please review the changes and confirm your selections by end of this week.

Review your benefits here:
https://company-benefits.net/employee-portal

If you have questions, contact HR at hr@company-benefits.net.

Best regards,
HR Department

dangerousPhrases.reason: Pressures the recipient to take action
Creates a deadline to prevent thorough verification

reasons: External domain 'company-benefits.net' may not be your actual company domain
Mild urgency with end-of-week deadline
Generic greeting without specific employee name
Link should be verified against known company portal URL

links.reason: External domain ‚Äî verify this is your company's actual benefits portal before clicking

recommendation: Verify with your HR department directly through known contact channels before clicking any links. The domain may be legitimate but should be confirmed.

subject: Today's Top Tech Stories - February 6, 2025
body:
Good morning!

Here are today's top tech stories:

1. AI Breakthrough: New model achieves human-level reasoning
2. Apple announces new product event for March
3. Startup raises $50M for cybersecurity platform

Read more at techcrunch.com

Unsubscribe from this newsletter
reasons: Sender domain matches known legitimate source (techcrunch.com)
No urgency or threatening language
No requests for personal information
Standard newsletter format with unsubscribe option
recommendation: This appears to be a legitimate newsletter. Safe to read and interact with.

subject: ‚ö†Ô∏è Unusual sign-in activity on your Microsoft account
body:
Microsoft account
Unusual sign-in activity

We detected something unusual about a recent sign-in to your Microsoft account.

Sign-in details:
Country/region: Russia
IP address: 185.220.101.45
Date: February 5, 2025
Platform: Linux
Browser: Firefox

If this wasn't you, please secure your account immediately:
https://micros0ft-security.com/account/verify

If you recognize this activity, you can ignore this message.

The Microsoft account team

dangerousPhrases.reason: Foreign location designed to cause panic

reasons: Domain 'micros0ft-security.com' uses '0' (zero) instead of 'o' to impersonate Microsoft
Creates fear with fake sign-in from suspicious location
Includes fake IP address and location details to appear legitimate
Urgent call to 'secure your account immediately'
Microsoft's real security alerts come from account.live.com or microsoft.com

links.reason: Fake Microsoft domain using zero instead of 'o'. Real Microsoft uses microsoft.com

recommendation: Do NOT click any links. This is a phishing attempt impersonating Microsoft. Check your real Microsoft account at account.microsoft.com directly.

subject: Your Amazon order #112-4837261 has shipped
body:
Hello,

Your order has shipped!

Order #112-4837261
Estimated delivery: February 8-10, 2025

Track your package:
https://amazon.com/gp/your-account/order-details?orderID=112-4837261

Thank you for shopping with us.

Amazon.com
reasons: Sender domain is legitimate amazon.com
Standard shipping notification format
No urgency or threatening language
Links point to official Amazon domain
recommendation: This appears to be a legitimate Amazon shipping notification. Safe to interact with.

subject: üéâ Congratulations! You've Won $1,500,000!
body:
CONGRATULATIONS!!!

You have been selected as the winner of the International Online Lottery!

Prize Amount: $1,500,000.00 USD

To claim your prize, you must provide:
- Full Name
- Date of Birth
- Bank Account Number
- Social Security Number

Respond within 48 hours or your prize will be forfeited.

Claim your prize now:
https://winner-notification.xyz/claim?ref=928374

Congratulations again!
International Lottery Commission

dangerousPhrases.reason: Fear of losing out to pressure action

reasons: Classic lottery/prize scam ‚Äî you cannot win a lottery you didn't enter
Requests highly sensitive personal and financial information
Uses .xyz domain which is commonly associated with scam sites
Excessive urgency with 48-hour deadline
Multiple exclamation marks and all-caps indicate unprofessional communication

links.reason: Suspicious .xyz domain used for prize scam. Will likely harvest personal data.

recommendation: This is a classic lottery scam. Delete immediately. Never share personal or financial information with unknown senders.

subject: New login from Chrome on Windows
body:
Hey there!

A new device was used to sign in to your GitHub account.

Device: Chrome on Windows
Location: San Francisco, CA, USA
Time: February 4, 2025 at 7:45 PM PST

If this was you, no further action is needed.

If this wasn't you, please review your security settings:
https://github.com/settings/security

Thanks,
The GitHub Team
reasons: Sender is legitimate github.com domain
Standard security notification format
No urgency or threats ‚Äî says 'no further action needed' if recognized
Link points to official GitHub security settings
recommendation: This is a legitimate GitHub security notification. If you recognize the sign-in, no action needed.

subject: Your payment was declined - Update billing info
body:
Netflix

We were unable to process your payment for the current billing period.

To keep enjoying Netflix, please update your payment information within 24 hours.

Update Payment Method:
https://netf1ix-account.com/billing/update

If your payment is not updated, your account will be suspended and all viewing history will be lost.

Netflix Support Team

dangerousPhrases.text: all viewing history will be lost

reasons: Domain 'netf1ix-account.com' uses '1' instead of 'l' to impersonate Netflix
Creates urgency with 24-hour deadline
Threatens account suspension and data loss
Real Netflix billing emails come from netflix.com
Exaggerated claim about losing viewing history

links.reason: Fake Netflix domain. Will capture credit card information.

recommendation: Do NOT enter payment information. Visit netflix.com directly to check your billing status. Report this email as phishing.
